text: The 2001 Asian Cycling Championships took place at Kaohsiung and Taichung, Taiwan from 8 to 15 July 2001. ==Medal summary== ===Road=== ====Men==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ====Women==== {| |- |Individual road race | | | |- |Individual time trial | | | |} ===Track=== ====Men==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |1 km time trial | | | |- |Keirin | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Elimination | | | |- |Madison |valign=top| | Amir Zargari Alireza Haghi |valign=top| |- |Team sprint | Takashi Kaneko Hiroyuki Nunoi Keiichi Omori | Cho Hyun-ok Song Kyung-bang Kim Chi-bum | Liu Chin-feng Lin Chih-hsun Lin Kun-hung |- |Team pursuit | Choi Soon-young Chun Dae-hong Cho Ho-sung Chang Il-nam | Chen Teng-tian Pai Chi-lin Ting Cheng-chang Tsai Shao-yu | Noriyuki Iijima Yusuke Kuroki Megumu Morohashi Kanotoshi Madoba |} ====Women==== {| |- |Sprint | | | |- |500 m time trial | | | |- |Individual pursuit | | | |- |Points race | | | |- |Elimination | | | |- |Team sprint | Kim Yong-mi Lee Jong-ae Ku Hyun-jin | Lu Yi-wen Wu Fang-ju Hsu Pei-wen | Nurhayati Secelia Sucestoria Santia Tri Kusuma |- |Team pursuit | Chen Chiung-yi Fang Fen-fang Lan Hsiao-yun Hwang He-xun | Nurhayati Secelia Sucestoria Santia Tri Kusuma Nuraini | Kim Yong-mi Lim Hang-jun Lim Mi-young Ku Hyun-jin |} ==Medal table== ==References== * Road Results * Track Results Asia Asia Cycling Category:Asian Cycling Championships Category:International cycle races hosted by Taiwan
